channel.title: Broadband Throttling
channel.description: I don't know whether any of you UK users have got Virgin broadband but they have this throttling system, where if you download more than 3GB(on my internet package) you get your speeds capped from 2.4mbytes/s to 500kbytes/s is there a way round this?

item.title: Broadband Throttling
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:23, topic:265528”]IIRC, in the Netherlands the Internet infrastructure is owned by one company. So all providers have to pay them to offer Internet to their customers. Which means higher prices.

We pay about €50 for 8 mbit Internet (we get about 5/6 mbit though) and unlimited calls to normal landlines. Calls to cellphones cost about 10-30 cents a minute IIRC, although it can be less.[/quote]
We pay about €35 for the same connection, except we don’t get the unlimited calls thing, I wouldn’t say it’s bad, but considering Speljohan can get 100/100 for about the same price… :\

Read full topic

item.title: Broadband Throttling
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Even at one megabyte a second, it only takes an hour to download 3gb…

Read full topic

item.title: Broadband Throttling
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Australia’s internet has cap, but you don’t hear us complaining

…seriously, I hardly ever make my 25gb cap (same thing, except my net gets shaped from 24mbps to 64kb/s, so there’s quite a difference), I don’t understand how you all complain about your caps, they’re huge

Read full topic

item.title: Broadband Throttling
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I’m on Virgin even though we get throttled now and thne it’s still by far the best in the UK.

Read full topic

item.title: Broadband Throttling
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

IIRC, in the Netherlands the Internet infrastructure is owned by one company. So all providers have to pay them to offer Internet to their customers. Which means higher prices.

We pay about €50 for 8 mbit Internet (we get about 5/6 mbit though) and unlimited calls to normal landlines. Calls to cellphones cost about 10-30 cents a minute IIRC, although it can be less.

Read full topic

item.title: Broadband Throttling
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:21, topic:265528”][quote author=bowserjr2 link=topic=350554.msg2694506#msg2694506 date=1236181226]

If you can afford it, who cares if it’s overpriced?
[/quote]Considering the fact you pay $53 for 100/100 here, everything else is overpriced. If you can compete with those prices, then fine.

What, Move to Sweden
For $53 you don’t even get 20000/1000 Kbit/s here I live.
For fiber, its 828$ for the fiber.
Then 123$ just for getting the Internet.
Then 258$ each month for 50/50 Mbit.

what shitty country are you living in[/quote]
Norway, Worlds “Best” country to live in.
But no capping on internett.
So I can download so much I want 24/7.

Read full topic

item.title: Broadband Throttling
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:18, topic:265528”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=350554.msg2693264#msg2693264 date=1236102524]
Niall jsut sign up with virgin fast speeds garunteed until you hit the 3gb limit, the cap is a bit gay specially seeing as how it so low and yeah outside of peak times the threshold is raised alot and then its only 1% of customers that get affected by the throttling
[/quote]

I’ve been asking my mum for months to phone up virgin and upgrade(as we’re only on 2mb) and she never does. :([/quote]
Niall just keep bugging her bout it for as long as you can eventually you’ll get the switch thats what i had to do
Oh and downloaded GTA:IV today outside of my throttling times

Time Elapsed: 2h 33m Downloaded: 13.8 GB Download Speed: 0.0kB/s (avg 2.2 MB/s)
that was what you call immense :P I think the torrent site helped as well, 588 seeds and 50 leeches

Read full topic

item.title: Broadband Throttling
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I’m supposed to get 8 megabits per second, which should equal 1 megabyte. Yet I barely hit 650 kbyte a second. The piss heads said they would double my speed when it still was 4 megabits a second. I could reach 420 kbyte a second at that time, so they didn’t even double it.

BTW, I don’t have Virgin, and I’m Dutch.

Read full topic

item.title: Broadband Throttling
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Niall jsut sign up with virgin fast speeds garunteed until you hit the 3gb limit, the cap is a bit gay specially seeing as how it so low and yeah outside of peak times the threshold is raised alot and then its only 1% of customers that get affected by the throttling

item.title: Broadband Throttling
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:9, topic:265528”][quote author=Niall link=topic=350554.msg2693075#msg2693075 date=1236089086]
Why is everyone so surprised he’s getting capped for downloading 3GB during peak hours? He’s getting 2.4MB/s (bytes, not bits).

EDIT: and I’m sure the cap only applies for peak hours.
[/quote]

19.2Mbps? Er, still 3GB is low.[/quote]

That’s during peak hours(see the website for times).

He can still download as much as he wants outside of those times at full uncapped speeds. I’d kill for those speeds, capped during peak hours or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Broadband Throttling
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

This looks great: http://allyours.virginmedia.com/html/50Mb/product_pricing_and_tech_info.html
Does not look like any 3GB usage limit.
Cheap prices there is in UK.

Nial: even with 2.4 Megabyte I’am surprised, even more since broadband like that should allow you to download much.

Read full topic

item.description:

Wow, I just read the site. That’s horrible, imo if you pay for an internet connection, you should be able to send and receive as much traffic as you want. Also, 3GB - that’s less than a DVD…

item.title: Broadband Throttling
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Change ISP.
If you pay for 2.4 Mbit (That is very little) you should be allowed to use it.

item.title: Broadband Throttling
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Err, it was in their TOS for a while then they removed it for a few months, I guess it’s back now.

Basically(from what I remember), if you download so much within peak hours(something like 10am to 6pm) your speed is dropped for 4 hours.

EDIT: See: http://www.virginmedia.com/help/traffic-management.php

Read full topic
